definitions.text: work done by one person or group that benefits another
examples: budget separately for goods and services

definitions.text: an act of help or assistance
the act of public worship following prescribed rules
a company or agency that performs a public service; subject to government regulation
employment in or work for another
examples: he retired after 30 years of service

definitions.text: a force that is a branch of the armed forces
Canadian writer (born in England) who wrote about life in the Yukon Territory (1874-1958)
tableware consisting of a complete set of articles (silver or dishware) for use at table
the act of mating by male animals
examples: the bull was worth good money in servicing fees

definitions.text: (law) the acts performed by an English feudal tenant for the benefit of his lord which formed the consideration for the property granted to him
(sports) a stroke that puts the ball in play
examples: his powerful serves won the game

definitions.text: the act of delivering a writ or summons upon someone
examples: he accepted service of the subpoena

definitions.text: periodic maintenance on a car or machine
examples: it was time for an overhaul on the tractor

definitions.text: the performance of duties by a waiter or servant
be used by; as of a utility
examples: The sewage plant served the neighboring communities
The garage served to shelter his horses
the washing machine needs to be serviced
male animals serve the females for breeding purposes
